intro: Zannichellia preissii, commonly known as the water starwort, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its submerged, branching stems and small, delicate leaves that are typically arranged in whorls. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often borne in clusters, and it thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Zannichellia preissii is often found in shallow waters with soft, muddy substrates. Its presence can indicate good water quality, as it is sensitive to pollution.
